content.raw:
@{557058:90bc87b0-2886-4377-a17c-3a6629a697ff} I talked to Shane and the user id doesn’t have nothing to do with this.   
  
@{557058:095b1e12-74ed-4e20-b44f-2f0745b616e0} Independently of the docker version, those parameters are not needed since docker-composer does not call `run.bash`. In others word, if you remove them, then you should still be able to `run multiple robots with the docker compose script` as you did before.  Try it!
content.html:
@Addisu Z. Taddese I talked to Shane and the user id doesn’t have nothing to do with this.

@Nate Koenig Independently of the docker version, those parameters are not needed since docker-composer does not call run.bash. In others word, if you remove them, then you should still be able to run multiple robots with the docker compose script as you did before. Try it!
